section.title: Introduction
section.para: In RapidDataMapper there are no configuration files, instead it uses PHP objects for storing the configuration. This enables a lot of customization as classes makes it possible to modify their behaviour by sub-classing.

The objects which contain the configurations are called descriptors, this is because they describe the mapping. All descriptors are either instances of Db_Descriptor or instances of a descendant class.

The Db_Descriptor class contains a lot of default values and assumptions, some of them are modifiable by changing properties or calling methods, others are modifiable by overriding one or several methods in a child class. This not only enables a user to have a simple and powerful way to configure a mapping, it also enables the user to create his own default descriptor settings with a subclass which is then used as the base class for his descriptors.
